Document.author: petere
Document.document: Make initdb print a message about which locale it is about to use. Re-add warning if the locale prevents LIKE-optimization. Done within initdb now.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Suppress duplicate logging of utility commands under debug_print_query.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First pass at schema-fying pg_dump/pg_restore. Much to do still, but the basic capability seems to work.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Forgot to handle 'opaque' function arguments in regprocedurein/out.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update for additional options in CREATE OPERATOR.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First pass at set-returning-functions in FROM, by Joe Conway with some kibitzing from Tom Lane. Not everything works yet, and there's no documentation or regression test, but let's commit this so Joe doesn't need to cope with tracking changes in so many files ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Get rid of long-since-vestigial Iter node type, in favor of adding a returns-set boolean field in Func and Oper nodes. This allows cleaner, more reliable tests for expressions returning sets in the planner and parser. For example, a WHERE clause returning a set is now detected and complained of in the parser, not only at runtime.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make operators have their own comments separate from those of the underlying functionSEMICOLON but cause psql's BACKSLASHdo to show the underlying function's comment if the operator has no comment of its own, to preserve the useful functionality of the original behavior. Also, implement COMMENT ON SCHEMA. Patch from Rod Taylor.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: AVG probably shouldn't be upper case here, considering that we don't upcase the others.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix typo in _copyAlterUserSetStmt.

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: Fix bug in pg_dump and psql (to reproduce the bug, just try pg_dump --nonexistingoption). per report from sugita@sra.co.jp on Thu, 09 May 2002 11:57:51 +0900 (JST) at pgsql-patches list. Illegal long options to pg_dump makes core on some systems, since it lacks the last null sentinel of struct option array. Attached is a patch made by Mr. Ishida Akio <iakio@pjam.jpweb.net>.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: fixed problem connecting to server with client_min_messages set to debug. The code was not expecting to receive notice messages during the connection handshake.

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: Fix bug in psql. per report from sugita@sra.co.jp on Thu, 09 May 2002 11:57:51 +0900 (JST) at pgsql-patches list. Illegal long options to pg_dump makes core on some systems, since it lacks the last null sentinel of struct option array. Attached is a patch made by Mr. Ishida Akio <iakio@pjam.jpweb.net>.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Make regression tests locale-proof by setting some locale categories to C at run-time, and providing alternative output files for different sort orders.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix lookup tables used for rounding interval data values when not using integer datetimes. Thanks to Tom Lane for spotting the problem.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unnecessary pfree's in geometric operators. At least one of these is actively dangerous, per bug report from Ewald Geschwinde 14-May-02, and several of the rest look suspicious to me. Since there is no longer any significant value in retail pfree's in these functions, just get rid of all of them for safety's sake.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unnecessary pfree's in geometric operators. At least one of these is actively dangerous, per bug report from Ewald Geschwinde 14-May-02, and several of the rest look suspicious to me. Since there is no longer any significant value in retail pfree's in these functions, just get rid of all of them for safety's sake.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix obsolete statement about permissions on COPY ref page, and confusion about TO/FROM direction in several places.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Merge the last few variable.c configuration variables into the generic GUC support. It's now possible to set datestyle, timezone, and client_encoding from postgresql.conf and per-database or per-user settings. Also, implement rollback of SET commands that occur in a transaction that later fails. Create a SET LOCAL var = value syntax that sets the variable only for the duration of the current transaction. All per previous discussions in pghackers.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Guard against empty-string results from pg_getlocale.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Extend syntax of CREATE FUNCTION to resemble SQL99.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Dept. of second thoughts: interaction between DoIt and makeDepend in set_config_option wasn't quite right. Also clean up a couple other things that could have been done better.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Support temporary setting of search path during CREATE SCHEMASEMICOLON this allows the example in the CREATE SCHEMA ref page to actually work now. Also, clean up when the transaction that initially creates a temp-table namespace is later aborted. Simplify internal representation of search path by folding special cases into the main list.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Get rid of the last few uses of typeidTypeName() rather than format_type_be() in error messages.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing fix_expr_references() step for the funcexpr of a FunctionScan plan node.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Change set_plan_references and join_references to take an rtable List rather than a Query nodeSEMICOLON this allows set_plan_references to recurse into subplans correctly. Fixes core dump on full outer joins in subplans. Also, invoke preprocess_expression on function RTEs' function expressions. This seems to fix the planner's problems with outer-level Vars in function RTEs.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Allow functions to be executed with the privileges of the function owner. I took the opportunity to remove the pg_proc.proistrusted field.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Revise command completion tags as per hackers message on 20 March.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Teach query_tree_walker, query_tree_mutator, and SS_finalize_plan to process function RTE expressions, which they were previously missing. This allows outer-Var references and subselects to work correctly in the arguments of a function RTE. Install check to prevent function RTEs from cross-referencing Vars of sibling FROM-items, which doesn't make any sense (if you want to join, write a JOIN or WHERE clause).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add display of sort keys to the default EXPLAIN output.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Dump privileges on functions, aggregates, languages.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Remove bitrotten view_perms test. Add some similar test cases to privileges test.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Reorder keyword token declarations alphabetically. Status of the keywords in the various standards can be found in the documentation these days.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: - Fixed reduce/reduce conflict in parser. - Synced preproc.y with gram.y. - Synced pgc.l with scan.l. - Synced keywords.c.

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: Update docs about new -N option

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: - Fixed some parser bugs. - Removed some simple rules to work arounf bison limit for now. - Update c_keywords.c to reflect changes in keywords.c.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Mark as done: > o -Disallow missing columns in INSERT ... VALUES, per ANSI

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Restructure indexscan API (index_beginscan, index_getnext) per yesterday's proposal to pghackers. Also remove unnecessary parameters to heap_beginscan, heap_rescan. I modified pg_proc.h to reflect the new numbers of parameters for the AM interface routines, but did not force an initdb because nothing actually looks at those fields.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair OPEN cursor(args), which I broke on 11/29/01 with a change to be smarter about parentheses in read_sql_construct(). Sigh.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair OPEN cursor(args), which I broke on 11/29/01 with a change to be smarter about parentheses in read_sql_construct(). Sigh.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Spell long option with -c not --, for compatibility's sake.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove global variable scanCommandId in favor of storing a command ID in snapshots, per my proposal of a few days ago. Also, tweak heapam.c routines (heap_insert, heap_update, heap_delete, heap_mark4update) to be passed the command ID to use, instead of doing GetCurrentCommandID. For catalog updates they'll still get passed current command ID, but for updates generated from the main executor they'll get passed the command ID saved in the snapshot the query is using. This should fix some corner cases associated with functions and triggers that advance current command ID while an outer query is still in progress.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove SetQuerySnapshot() from FETCH processing. No longer necessary or appropriate, since the snapshot that will be used by the cursor was frozen when ExecutorStart was run for it.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Since COPY fires triggers, it seems like a good idea for it to use a frozen (copied) snapshot too. Move execMain's snapshot copying code out into a subroutine in case we find other places that need it.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: 1) Support Keyset Driven driver cursors. 2) Supprt ARD precision/scale and SQL_C_NUEMRIC. 3) Minimal implementation of SQLGetDiagField(). 4) SQLRowCount() reports the result of SQLSetPos and SQLBulkOperation. 5) int8 -> SQL_NUMERIC for Microsoft Jet. 6) Support isolation level change. 7) ODBC3.0 SQLSTATE code. 8) Append mode log files.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Allow CREATE VIEW as SELECT CTID, .... SELECT currtid( a view, ..).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Un-break table creation.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make RelationForgetRelation error out if the relcache entry has nonzero reference count. This avoids leaving dangling pointers around, as in recent bug report against sequences (bug# 671).

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add optional "validator" function to languages that can validate the function body (and other properties) as a function in the language is created. This generalizes ad hoc code that already existed for the built-in languages. The validation now happens after the pg_proc tuple of the new function is created, so it is possible to define recursive SQL functions. Add some regression test cases that cover bogus function definition attempts.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make RelationForgetRelation error out if the relcache entry has nonzero reference count. This avoids leaving dangling pointers around, as in recent bug report against sequences (bug# 671).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor kibitzing.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Modify sequence state storage to eliminate dangling-pointer problem exemplified by bug #671. Moving the storage to relcache turned out to be a bad idea because relcache might decide to discard the info. Instead, open and close the relcache entry on each sequence operation, and use a record of the current XID to discover whether we already hold AccessShareLock on the sequence.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add $(LDFLAGS) to Windows make rule for postgres executable. Needed to do profiling on Cygwin, per report from Dave Page.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Change PL/Tcl build to use configured compiler and Makefile.shlib system, not Tcl-provided one. Make sure export file, if any, is cleaned. Tcl configuration is now read directly in configure and recorded in Makefile.global. This eliminates some duplicate efforts and allows for easier hand-editing of the results, if necessary.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Mark index entries "killed" when they are no longer visible to any transaction, so as to avoid returning them out of the index AM. Saves repeated heap_fetch operations on frequently-updated rows. Also detect queries on unique keys (equality to all columns of a unique index), and don't bother continuing scan once we have found first match. Killing is implemented in the btree and hash AMs, but not yet in rtree or gist, because there isn't an equally convenient place to do it in those AMs (the outer amgetnext routine can't do it without re-pinning the index page). Did some small cleanup on APIs of HeapTupleSatisfies, heap_fetch, and index_insert to make this a little easier.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Wups, managed to break ANALYZE with one aspect of that heap_fetch change.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add 'volatile' to suppress gcc warning. Not sure why this warning wasn't seen before, maybe the Tcl compiler flags were less strict.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix coding error in UTF conversion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: AlterDatabaseSet() forgot to update the indexes on pg_database.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove AMI_OVERRIDE tests from tqual.c routinesSEMICOLON they aren't necessary and just slow down normal operations (only fractionally, but a cycle saved is a cycle earned). Improve documentation of AMI_OVERRIDE behavior.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add > * Add getpid() function to backend

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Distinguish between MaxHeapAttributeNumber and MaxTupleAttributeNumber, where the latter is made slightly larger to allow for in-memory tuples containing resjunk attributes. Responds to today's complaint that one cannot UPDATE a table containing the allegedly-legal maximum number of columns. Also, apply Manfred Koizar's recent patch to avoid extra alignment padding when there is a null bitmap. This saves bytes in some cases while not creating any backward-compatibility problem AFAICS.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update dblink to work with qualified relation names. From Joe Conway.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update: > * Add BSD-licensed qsort() for 32-bit Solaris

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair error with not adjusting active scans properly after gistSplit. Patch from Teodor Sigaev.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair error with not adjusting active scans properly after gistSplit. Patch from Teodor Sigaev.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a bug with building rtree_gist indexes. Patch from Teodor Sigaev.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a bug with building rtree_gist indexes. Patch from Teodor Sigaev.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair incorrect dumping of user-defined aggregate with null initcond. (Already fixed in current, but need a patch for 7.2.2.)

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Change PL/Perl and Pg interface build to use configured compiler and Makefile.shlib system, not MakeMaker.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In default nextval('foo') expression for a SERIAL column, use double quotes only when necessary.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Queries used by ruleutils were not schema-proof.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rework pg_dump namespace search criteria so that dumping of user objects having names conflicting with system objects will work --- the search path is now user-schema, pg_catalog rather than implicitly the other way around. Note this requires being careful to explicitly qualify references to system names whenever pg_catalog is not first in the search path. Also, add support for dumping ACLs of schemas.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rearrange LOG_CONNECTIONS code so that two log messages are made: one immediately upon forking to handle a new connection, and one after the authentication cycle is finished. Per today's pggeneral discussion.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove 32-bit mention: > * Add BSD-licensed qsort() for Solaris

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some more not-schema-aware queries in pg_dump. Also fix some places that would do the wrong thing with BLOB OIDs exceeding 2G.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Another place that needs schema qualification.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a note about the interpretation of amcanmulticol and amindexnulls: a multicolumn-capable index AM *must* support nulls in index columns after the first one.

Document.author: davec
Document.document: added imported/exported key testDatabaseMetaDataTest.java

Document.author: davec
Document.document: small fix to testExportedKeys

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Improve manual's discussion of locking and MVCC.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix timestamp to date conversion for the case where timestamp uses a double precision storage format. Previously applied the same math as used for the 64-bit integer storage format case, which was wrong. Problem introduced recently when the 64-bit storage format was implemented.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Mention btree: > * Add FILLFACTOR to btree index creation

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Indent verbatim environments.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add section explaining unspecified expression evaluation order.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow pod2man 5.005p3 to work with our current sources.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove mention of timestamp() in SGML docsSEMICOLON doesn't exist anymore.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add PQescapeString and PQescapeBytea for Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Mention SM_USER should be the same size as the others.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch fixes a typo in the documentation for SET CONSTRAINTS. Neil Conway <neilconway@rogers.com>

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update index growth problem.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Small patch to correct the default arraysize associated with the Cursor object's fetchmany() method. The API and inline documentation state that the default is 1. It currently defaults to 5. Patrick Macdonald

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove NOCREATE patch from TODO.detail.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: fixed bug reported by Noel Rappin (nrappin@sockeye.com) java Array type handled Timestamps incorrectly

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update as done: > * -Add deleted bit to index tuples to reduce heap access

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Document that SM_* variables should be longer.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update Japanese FAQ, from Jun Kuwamura

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add /dev/zero mention for anon mmap().

Document.author: davec
Document.document: fixed getImported/ExportedKeys to be simpler, and return the correct number of keys

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Add *Int8 As* option.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Add missing win_setup.h.

Document.author: davec
Document.document: change table name to lower case in getColumns

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Mark as done: > o -Abort all SET changes made in an aborted transaction

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix interface example errors causes by backend changes. Permaine Cheung

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow DEFERRABLE UNIQUE constraints

Document.author: barry
Document.document: fixed bug reported by cc.ais40@wanadoo.fr where getObject was returning an Integer for a smallint datatype instead of a Short

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove int16 from libpgeasy examples. Improve error reporting.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: None.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch fixes a problem with InstallXLogFileSegment()'s use of link() under Cygwin: http://archives.postgresql.org/pgsql-cygwin/2002-04/msg00072.php Note that it appears that BeOS and Netware also have the above or similar problem. I have only verified that PostgreSQL builds under Cygwin with this patch. Since I cannot reproduce the problem, I cannot verify that the proposed patch solves it. Nevertheless, both Barry Pederson and David P. Caldwell attest that this patch solves the problem. See the following for details: http://archives.postgresql.org/pgsql-cygwin/2002-05/msg00043.php http://archives.postgresql.org/pgsql-cygwin/2002-05/msg00040.php Jason Tishler

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Please apply attached patch to contrib/intarray (7.2, 7.3). Fixed bug with '=' operator for gist__int_ops and define '=' operator for gist__intbig_ops opclass. Now '=' operator is consistent with standard 'array' type. Thanks Achilleus Mantzios for bug report and suggestion. Oleg Bartunov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Please apply attached patch to contrib/intarray (7.2, 7.3). Fixed bug with '=' operator for gist__int_ops and define '=' operator for gist__intbig_ops opclass. Now '=' operator is consistent with standard 'array' type. Thanks Achilleus Mantzios for bug report and suggestion. Oleg Bartunov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix for factorial(0::int2) returning 1, from sugita@sra.co.jp.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Improve readability of factorial, from Florian Weimer.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove DEBUG_LEVEL from postgresql.conf. Now uses CLIENT/SERVER_MIN_MESSAGES.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update new Russian FAQ, from Victor Vislobokov

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Get rid of the last few uses of typeidTypeName() rather than format_type_be() in error messages.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix obsolete statement about permissions on COPY ref page, and confusion about TO/FROM direction in several places.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Make regression tests locale-proof by setting some locale categories to C at run-time, and providing alternative output files for different sort orders.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Make initdb print a message about which locale it is about to use. Re-add warning if the locale prevents LIKE-optimization. Done within initdb now.

Document.document: added imported/exported key testDatabaseMetaDataTest.java

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Un-break table creation.

Document.document: Update docs about new -N option

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: Fix bug in psql. per report from sugita@sra.co.jp on Thu, 09 May 2002 11:57:51 +0900 (JST) at pgsql-patches list. Illegal long options to pg_dump makes core on some systems, since it lacks the last null sentinel of struct option array. Attached is a patch made by Mr. Ishida Akio <iakio@pjam.jpweb.net>.

Document.author: ishii
Document.document: Fix bug in pg_dump and psql (to reproduce the bug, just try pg_dump --nonexistingoption). per report from sugita@sra.co.jp on Thu, 09 May 2002 11:57:51 +0900 (JST) at pgsql-patches list. Illegal long options to pg_dump makes core on some systems, since it lacks the last null sentinel of struct option array. Attached is a patch made by Mr. Ishida Akio <iakio@pjam.jpweb.net>.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update Japanese FAQ, from Jun Kuwamura

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow pod2man 5.005p3 to work with our current sources.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add section explaining unspecified expression evaluation order.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Mention btree: > * Add FILLFACTOR to btree index creation

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some more not-schema-aware queries in pg_dump. Also fix some places that would do the wrong thing with BLOB OIDs exceeding 2G.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: AlterDatabaseSet() forgot to update the indexes on pg_database.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor kibitzing.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: fixed problem connecting to server with client_min_messages set to debug. The code was not expecting to receive notice messages during the connection handshake.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a bug with building rtree_gist indexes. Patch from Teodor Sigaev.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix a bug with building rtree_gist indexes. Patch from Teodor Sigaev.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair OPEN cursor(args), which I broke on 11/29/01 with a change to be smarter about parentheses in read_sql_construct(). Sigh.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair OPEN cursor(args), which I broke on 11/29/01 with a change to be smarter about parentheses in read_sql_construct(). Sigh.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Reorder keyword token declarations alphabetically. Status of the keywords in the various standards can be found in the documentation these days.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Guard against empty-string results from pg_getlocale.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix lookup tables used for rounding interval data values when not using integer datetimes. Thanks to Tom Lane for spotting the problem.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rearrange LOG_CONNECTIONS code so that two log messages are made: one immediately upon forking to handle a new connection, and one after the authentication cycle is finished. Per today's pggeneral discussion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Spell long option with -c not --, for compatibility's sake.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Remove bitrotten view_perms test. Add some similar test cases to privileges test.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing fix_expr_references() step for the funcexpr of a FunctionScan plan node.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unnecessary pfree's in geometric operators. At least one of these is actively dangerous, per bug report from Ewald Geschwinde 14-May-02, and several of the rest look suspicious to me. Since there is no longer any significant value in retail pfree's in these functions, just get rid of all of them for safety's sake.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unnecessary pfree's in geometric operators. At least one of these is actively dangerous, per bug report from Ewald Geschwinde 14-May-02, and several of the rest look suspicious to me. Since there is no longer any significant value in retail pfree's in these functions, just get rid of all of them for safety's sake.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair incorrect dumping of user-defined aggregate with null initcond. (Already fixed in current, but need a patch for 7.2.2.)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix coding error in UTF conversion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Wups, managed to break ANALYZE with one aspect of that heap_fetch change.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add optional "validator" function to languages that can validate the function body (and other properties) as a function in the language is created. This generalizes ad hoc code that already existed for the built-in languages. The validation now happens after the pg_proc tuple of the new function is created, so it is possible to define recursive SQL functions. Add some regression test cases that cover bogus function definition attempts.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Dept. of second thoughts: interaction between DoIt and makeDepend in set_config_option wasn't quite right. Also clean up a couple other things that could have been done better.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Improve readability of factorial, from Florian Weimer.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix for factorial(0::int2) returning 1, from sugita@sra.co.jp.

Document.author: davec
Document.document: change table name to lower case in getColumns

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair error with not adjusting active scans properly after gistSplit. Patch from Teodor Sigaev.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair error with not adjusting active scans properly after gistSplit. Patch from Teodor Sigaev.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Allow CREATE VIEW as SELECT CTID, .... SELECT currtid( a view, ..).

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Dump privileges on functions, aggregates, languages.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Support temporary setting of search path during CREATE SCHEMASEMICOLON this allows the example in the CREATE SCHEMA ref page to actually work now. Also, clean up when the transaction that initially creates a temp-table namespace is later aborted. Simplify internal representation of search path by folding special cases into the main list.

Document.author: davec
Document.document: fixed getImported/ExportedKeys to be simpler, and return the correct number of keys

Document.author: barry
Document.document: fixed bug reported by Noel Rappin (nrappin@sockeye.com) java Array type handled Timestamps incorrectly

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Distinguish between MaxHeapAttributeNumber and MaxTupleAttributeNumber, where the latter is made slightly larger to allow for in-memory tuples containing resjunk attributes. Responds to today's complaint that one cannot UPDATE a table containing the allegedly-legal maximum number of columns. Also, apply Manfred Koizar's recent patch to avoid extra alignment padding when there is a null bitmap. This saves bytes in some cases while not creating any backward-compatibility problem AFAICS.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Allow functions to be executed with the privileges of the function owner. I took the opportunity to remove the pg_proc.proistrusted field.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update as done: > * -Add deleted bit to index tuples to reduce heap access

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove mention of timestamp() in SGML docsSEMICOLON doesn't exist anymore.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove global variable scanCommandId in favor of storing a command ID in snapshots, per my proposal of a few days ago. Also, tweak heapam.c routines (heap_insert, heap_update, heap_delete, heap_mark4update) to be passed the command ID to use, instead of doing GetCurrentCommandID. For catalog updates they'll still get passed current command ID, but for updates generated from the main executor they'll get passed the command ID saved in the snapshot the query is using. This should fix some corner cases associated with functions and triggers that advance current command ID while an outer query is still in progress.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Revise command completion tags as per hackers message on 20 March.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Please apply attached patch to contrib/intarray (7.2, 7.3). Fixed bug with '=' operator for gist__int_ops and define '=' operator for gist__intbig_ops opclass. Now '=' operator is consistent with standard 'array' type. Thanks Achilleus Mantzios for bug report and suggestion. Oleg Bartunov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Please apply attached patch to contrib/intarray (7.2, 7.3). Fixed bug with '=' operator for gist__int_ops and define '=' operator for gist__intbig_ops opclass. Now '=' operator is consistent with standard 'array' type. Thanks Achilleus Mantzios for bug report and suggestion. Oleg Bartunov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Document that SM_* variables should be longer.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Small patch to correct the default arraysize associated with the Cursor object's fetchmany() method. The API and inline documentation state that the default is 1. It currently defaults to 5. Patrick Macdonald

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Teach query_tree_walker, query_tree_mutator, and SS_finalize_plan to process function RTE expressions, which they were previously missing. This allows outer-Var references and subselects to work correctly in the arguments of a function RTE. Install check to prevent function RTEs from cross-referencing Vars of sibling FROM-items, which doesn't make any sense (if you want to join, write a JOIN or WHERE clause).

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Indent verbatim environments.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove 32-bit mention: > * Add BSD-licensed qsort() for Solaris

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rework pg_dump namespace search criteria so that dumping of user objects having names conflicting with system objects will work --- the search path is now user-schema, pg_catalog rather than implicitly the other way around. Note this requires being careful to explicitly qualify references to system names whenever pg_catalog is not first in the search path. Also, add support for dumping ACLs of schemas.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update: > * Add BSD-licensed qsort() for 32-bit Solaris

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add display of sort keys to the default EXPLAIN output.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix interface example errors causes by backend changes. Permaine Cheung

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Add missing win_setup.h.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove NOCREATE patch from TODO.detail.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add PQescapeString and PQescapeBytea for Win32.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update dblink to work with qualified relation names. From Joe Conway.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add > * Add getpid() function to backend

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove AMI_OVERRIDE tests from tqual.c routinesSEMICOLON they aren't necessary and just slow down normal operations (only fractionally, but a cycle saved is a cycle earned). Improve documentation of AMI_OVERRIDE behavior.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add $(LDFLAGS) to Windows make rule for postgres executable. Needed to do profiling on Cygwin, per report from Dave Page.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Mark as done: > o -Disallow missing columns in INSERT ... VALUES, per ANSI

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: The attached patch fixes a problem with InstallXLogFileSegment()'s use of link() under Cygwin: http://archives.postgresql.org/pgsql-cygwin/2002-04/msg00072.php Note that it appears that BeOS and Netware also have the above or similar problem. I have only verified that PostgreSQL builds under Cygwin with this patch. Since I cannot reproduce the problem, I cannot verify that the proposed patch solves it. Nevertheless, both Barry Pederson and David P. Caldwell attest that this patch solves the problem. See the following for details: http://archives.postgresql.org/pgsql-cygwin/2002-05/msg00043.php http://archives.postgresql.org/pgsql-cygwin/2002-05/msg00040.php Jason Tishler

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Restructure indexscan API (index_beginscan, index_getnext) per yesterday's proposal to pghackers. Also remove unnecessary parameters to heap_beginscan, heap_rescan. I modified pg_proc.h to reflect the new numbers of parameters for the AM interface routines, but did not force an initdb because nothing actually looks at those fields.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix timestamp to date conversion for the case where timestamp uses a double precision storage format. Previously applied the same math as used for the 64-bit integer storage format case, which was wrong. Problem introduced recently when the 64-bit storage format was implemented.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Improve manual's discussion of locking and MVCC.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Change PL/Perl and Pg interface build to use configured compiler and Makefile.shlib system, not MakeMaker.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Change PL/Tcl build to use configured compiler and Makefile.shlib system, not Tcl-provided one. Make sure export file, if any, is cleaned. Tcl configuration is now read directly in configure and recorded in Makefile.global. This eliminates some duplicate efforts and allows for easier hand-editing of the results, if necessary.
